awd_titl_txt: Instrumentation for Mineral Separation and U-Pb GeochemistryLaboratories for Undergraduates
awd_abstract_narration: Williams College will purchase equipment to establish mineral                   separation and uranium-lead geochemistry laboratories.  These                   laboratories will be used for undergraduate research projects in                geochronology, and to improve instruction in several undergraduate              geology courses.  The mineral separation equipment will be used to              concentrate heavy minerals from sediments and sedimentary rock and to           isolate fossils in courses in geomorphology, paleontology, and                  sedimentology.  Together with the equipment for carrying out U-Pb               geochemistry it will be used in courses in tectonics and geochronology          to illustrate the principles of isotopic dating.                                                                                                                The NSF grant of $16,898 for equipment will be matched by an equal              amount of funds from Williams College.  In addition, Williams College           is providing approximately $50,000 in funds for building renovation to          accommodate the new equipment.
